aboutScholarships.title: What is a Scholarship?
aboutScholarships.whatIs: A scholarship is financial aid provided to students to help cover the cost of education. Unlike loans, scholarships do not need to be repaid. They are awarded based on various criteria such as academic merit, financial need, field of study, or community involvement.
aboutScholarships.fullDesc: Covers all tuition fees, living expenses, and sometimes travel costs. This is the most competitive type.
aboutScholarships.partialDesc: Covers part of the tuition fees. Students need to fund the remaining costs themselves.
aboutScholarships.grantDesc: One-time or recurring financial assistance, often based on financial need rather than academic merit.
aboutScholarships.step1: Browse our scholarship database and use filters to narrow your search
aboutScholarships.step2: Check eligibility requirements carefully before applying
aboutScholarships.step3: Note application deadlines and prepare documents early
aboutScholarships.step4: Prepare your application materials (transcripts, recommendation letters, motivation letter)
aboutScholarships.tip1: Apply early â€” don't wait until the deadline
aboutScholarships.tip2: Read all requirements carefully and follow instructions exactly
aboutScholarships.tip3: Write a strong motivation letter that tells your personal story
aboutScholarships.tip4: Ask teachers for recommendation letters at least 2 weeks in advance
aboutScholarships.tip5: Apply to multiple scholarships to increase your chances
aboutScholarships.ctaDesc: Browse available scholarships and find the right one for you.

definition.title: Scholarship = Financial Support for Your Education
definition.content: A scholarship is money provided to support people who want to study at a university or vocational training school.

whenToUse.title: When to use it:
whenToUse.reason1: You want to go to university but don't have enough money.
whenToUse.reason2: You want to study but cannot afford the tuition fees.
whenToUse.reason3: You want to continue your studies while helping your family.
whenToUse.cta: ðŸ‘‰ Scholarships are there to help you!

benefit1.title: Less worry about costs
benefit1.desc: Covers tuition, textbooks, and living expenses.

benefit2.title: Don't give up on your dreams
benefit2.desc: Study what you love and aim for your dream career regardless of your financial situation.

benefit3.title: Various types available
benefit3.desc: Full coverage, partial support, non-repayable grants, or low-interest loans.

type1.title: Type 1: Grant (Non-repayable)
type1.desc: Money you get for free. No need to pay back after graduation. Usually for students with top grades or those in financial need. (High competition!)

type2.title: Type 2: Loan (Repayable)
type2.desc: Money you borrow. You pay it back in small amounts after you start working. Lower interest than banks (or zero interest).

type3.title: Type 3: Work-Study
type3.desc: A set deal with part-time work. You work at the university (e.g., library) or an NGO, and in return, your tuition is waived or reduced.

requirements.title: Requirements to Apply
requirements.req1: Grades: Maintaining a certain average (e.g., over 60%).
requirements.req2: Financial Status: Proof of financial need (e.g., family income certificate).
requirements.req4: Location: Some are specific to students from rural provinces.
requirements.req5: Field of Study: Some are limited to IT, Medicine, Agriculture, etc.

process.title: The Application Process
process.step1: Search: Look on Facebook, university websites, or ask friends.
process.step2: Check Conditions: Confirm if you meet the grade, age, and financial criteria.
process.step3: Apply: Prepare documents (Transcripts, Income proof, Personal statement, Recommendation letter).
process.step4: Selection: Document review, Interview, or sometimes a Test.
process.step5: Success!: Receive the scholarship and start your university life.

q1.a: A: Anyone can apply, but you must meet the specific criteria for each scholarship.

q2.a: A: Yes! If the conditions allow, you can combine them.

q3.q: Q3: Is there a fee to apply?
q3.a: A: Most are free. If they ask for money, it's likely a scam!

q4.a: A: Don't give up! New opportunities appear every year.

q5.a: A: Grade 12 is the best time to start, but some are available after you enter university.

tips.title: Tips for Success
tips.tip1: Start Early: Prepare well before the deadline.
tips.tip2: Ask Teachers: They have valuable information.
tips.tip3: Ask Friends: Seniors and friends might know hidden opportunities.
tips.tip4: Check Social Media: Search on Facebook and Telegram.
tips.tip5: Contact Universities: Ask the university offices directly.

scams.title: Stay Safe from Scams!
scams.trust1: Offered by universities, government, or well-known NGOs

final.title: Finally
final.message: Scholarships are your right. Don't let money stop your dreams. Many people want to support students like you. Take courage and apply!

vocationalGuide.heroTitle: Empower Your Future! Complete Guide to the "Vocational Training Program"
vocationalGuide.heroSubtitle: Are you worried about your future or want to support your family but cannot afford tuition fees? Here is a golden opportunity from the Cambodian government! This isn't just a school â€” it's a chance to gain professional skills while receiving financial support.

section1.title: 1. Learn for Free and Get Paid

free.title: Zero Tuition Fees
free.desc: The training is 100% free of charge.

stipend.title: Monthly Stipend
stipend.desc: Students with an IDPoor card or from vulnerable households will receive 280,000 Riels (approx. $70) per month.

short.title: Short-term Training
short.desc: In just 4 months, you can acquire high-demand skills and start your career.

section3.title: 3. Top Institutes in Phnom Penh

npic.name: NPIC (National Polytechnic Institute of Cambodia)
npic.desc: Offers the widest range of 33 skills.

ppi.desc: Strong in automotive, electricity, and construction.

section3.ptcNote: Note: Provincial Training Centers (PTC) are also available in all 25 provinces.

section4.title: 4. Important Notes
